ideaArguments.title: Develop
ideaArguments.text: At the heart of a party are political ideas, motions and debates. Our app allows you to develop ideas together. An integrated proposal and voting system structures the creation process.

ideaArguments.title: Automate
ideaArguments.text: The idea is automatically forwarded to events for consultation and decision-making.

ideaArguments.title: Share
ideaArguments.text: Ideas are advertised and shared in other social networks. If you like the idea, you can clone the idea.

ideaArguments.title: Reduce Complexity
ideaArguments.text: New supporters strengthen the relevance. More room for the idea, less room for the bureaucracy.

groupArguments.title: Organize
groupArguments.text: Each structure has its own 'space'. An elected team of administrators manages the Space. A wiki provides an overview of elected officials, subgroups and core political content.

groupArguments.title: Discuss
groupArguments.text: Each Space contains a stream, in which the discussion takes place together. Tools for project management and an event tool enable more power in the election campaign!

groupArguments.title: Inform
groupArguments.text: All members are automatically informed about news.

eventArguments.title: Decide
eventArguments.text: Our system automates events in the background and frees up time for the essential: shaping politics and making decisions!

eventArguments.title: Coordinate
eventArguments.text: Our management system for events (e.g. party conferences) creates an automated timeline. Topics are integrated (e.g. elections, ideas etc.), debates are coordinated.

eventArguments.title: Update
eventArguments.text: Logs, ToDo-lists and request forwarding are started. Decisions are available worldwide in real time. Politics becomes faster and more comprehensible.

searchArguments.title: Include
searchArguments.text: Our system creates a decentralized access to all information about political ideas, focal points of politicians, proposals, events, tasks and divisions - at any time and any place in the world!

searchArguments.title: Find
searchArguments.text: For information to deliver added value, the right information must be available at the right time. We provide an intelligent search system for this purpose.

searchArguments.title: Use
searchArguments.text: State of the art searching enables better decisions and a knowledge advantage for better campaigns and better election campaigns.

communicationArguments.title: Chat
communicationArguments.text: Modern chats enable modern communication. Cross-platform integration enables the integration of classic email communication.

communicationArguments.title: Integrate
communicationArguments.text: Our streams involve all members in discussions - regardless of whether they put children to bed or work the night shift. Streams are the heart of our internal communication. In the future, disabled people can join events via video chats.

communicationArguments.title: Renew
communicationArguments.text: Modern communication tools enable modern working methods and thus the integration of young and new members!

dataArguments.title: Trustful
dataArguments.text: The app only needs information that is already known: Where you live, where you are politically active and which topics you are interested in! No additional information is collected or evaluated.

dataArguments.title: Global & barrier free
dataArguments.text: Our network is multilingual, can be read aloud by the browser and is therefore globally and barrier-free accessible.

dataArguments.title: Universal
dataArguments.text: The app itself is available as a progressive web app, platform-independent in the browser as well as in app stores, e.g. in the Google Playstore. Thus, all functions are independent of the technical equipment.

prototype.visualizeText-1: To talk about technology that is not there is very abstract.
prototype.visualizeText-2: We want to visualize and make tangible the ideas of how politics can be improved through technology in a global and digital world.
prototype.discussText: The prototype is a basis for a discussion and at the same time an invitation: To participate and to shape the tools of tomorrow's politics!
prototype.testText-1: We want to release a beta version for testing by March 2021.
prototype.testText-2: Until then, click on a button in the visual prototype to test our ideas!

teamMembers.name: Tobias Hassebrock
motivationArguments: I am convinced that global challenges such as climate change or the corona crisis also need global solutions.
At the same time, politics must solve local problems. But local problems usually occur more than once in the world.
Both types of problems can be better solved with a networked platform. That is our goal!

functionalQuestions.question: What is the unique selling point of our app compared to other social networks?
functionalQuestions.answer: There is no other social network that maps inner-party processes in real time.

legalQuestions.question: Does the app make decisions online?
legalQuestions.answer: No, no decisions are made online. All decisions are made offline and simultaneously mirrored online. However, the decision making process can be done online, but the decision itself always takes place at a meeting.

legalQuestions.question: Do statutes have to be changed for the introduction of this app?
legalQuestions.answer: No, the app only mirrors decisions that are made in real meetings in the ways previously provided for in the statutes. However, the administrative processes surrounding the decision are automated so that the contents of the statutes (e.g. decisions) can be processed more efficiently. Accordingly, the system conforms to previous statutes.

introductionQuestions.question: How would the use be introduced?
introductionQuestions.answer: As soon as the beta version is available, outlines can register as testers. The test would then have to be decided democratically on site.

introductionQuestions.question: What is the General Secretary's position on this project?
introductionQuestions.answer: Both the party executive committee and the secretary general are informed about this project. The project was also presented several times in Berlin, where interest was expressed. The Federal Party Congress 2019 has also formally approved the introduction of such a system in the main proposal.

implementationQuestions.question: Which program was used to create the click dummy?
implementationQuestions.answer: The prototype was created with the free Adobe XD program from the Adobe Creative Cloud. Adobe XD or Figma are our previous favorites for prototype design.

implementationQuestions.question: Is there already a proposal for implementation?
implementationQuestions.answer: Yes, we would prefer a progressive web app, as it is platform independent. For this we currently prefer Angular + AngularMaterial in combination with AngularFire and Firestore. Angular is a modern framework for frontend development and Firestore is a modern NoSQL database as part of a SAAS (Software as a Service) offering.

implementationQuestions.question: Where can I find more information on technical implementation?
implementationQuestions.answer: More information about the technical implementation can be found in our Github repository. The project is open source, so all source code can be viewed and tracked online.

implementationQuestions.question: Why is a Google database being considered with Firestore?
implementationQuestions.answer: Google Firestore is a state-of-the-art, cloud based NoSQL database as part of a SAAS (Software as a Service offering), which is available free of charge with a generous free tier and many standardized backend services. As this project has very limited resources with one volunteer developer, Firestore offers a good start to get to the goal quickly. The database is also DSGVO compliant when used correctly.
